page.title: 11TRANSPORT, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: Because this is a rural area,several miles from the nearest towns,transport is very important.In the late 19th century a branch line of the Great Western Railway was extended to Great Somerford,and in this century to Little Somerford,providing what Portia Hobbs,a local historian,has described as "the best public transport this village has ever had".Sadly,because it did not pay the line was closed and those who do not own cars now depend on the local bus services. At present there is a bus service to Swindon 5 times a day,and one to Malmesbury which runs 6 times a day.A mini-bus also provides a service to Chippenham. Since the 2 Somerford schools were replaced by our school,many children have to come by bus.This coming year they will have to pay 25p a day.
